annotatable.title: Kelly Clarkson
annotatable.link_title: Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
Kelly Brianne Clarkson (born April 24, 1982) is an American singer, songwriter, and occasional actress. In 2002, she came to prominence after winning the first season of American Idol, and has since been established as “The Original American Idol”. Her debut single, “A Moment Like This”, topped the US Billboard Hot 100 and broke the record for the biggest jump to number one in the chart’s history.

Her first album, Thankful included the top ten single “Miss Independent”, which earned her first Grammy nomination. Her second album Breakaway produced the hit single “Since U Been Gone” which reached number two on the Hot 100 and was certified platinum by the RIAA.

Clarkson went in a different direction with her self-creatively-controlled third album, My December. It debuted at number two on the Billboard 200 and produced the top-ten single “Never Again.” Her fourth album, All I Ever Wanted debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. Lead single “My Life Would Suck Without You” re-broke the record for biggest jump to number one on the Hot 100, jumping 97-1 in its second week on the chart. The record still stands today.

Fifth album Stronger produced the top-ten “Mr. Know It All” and her third number one, “Stronger (What Doesn’t Kill You).” Later, she released her greatest hits album, producing the top-twenty single “Catch My Breath.” Her holiday album, Wrapped in Red became the highest-selling holiday album of 2013, which made Clarkson the first female to accomplish a feat.

Her sixth album, Piece by Piece, was released on March 3, 2015. Lead single “Heartbeat Song” was released on January 12, 2015, and has peaked at 21 on the Hot 100.

annotatable.title: Piece by Piece
annotatable.link_title: Piece by Piece by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
‘Piece by Piece’ is the title track off Kelly Clarkson’s sixth studio album. Written by Kelly Clarkson and Greg Kurstin (who also produced the track), the mid-tempo ballad  tells the story of her life then and now. Highlighting the pain and damage felt when her father left her in pieces, Kelly sings how “he” (her husband, Brandon Blackstock) helped put her back together, restoring her faith in men in general and fathers. It is a sequel to Because of You, as a “happy ending”.

During the final chorus, Kelly sings how she will never treat her daughter the way her father treated her, and neither will her husband.

annotatable.title: Because of You
annotatable.link_title: Because of You by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
“Because of You” is Kelly Clarkson’s third single from her second album Breakaway. It was a song she wrote when she was 16 years old as a reflection of the impact on her parents' divorce; she was 6 years old at the time. In the video below, she explains how she really wanted the song to be included on her inaugural album (Thankful), but NRG Recording Studios (her record label) had different views on it and didn’t think it was suitable for the album.

She then polished the song with David Hodges and Ben Moody before successfully convincing her label to include it on Breakaway. Fans in the U.S. fell in love with it, as it peaked at #7 on Billboard’s Hot 100. International fanbases were even more captivated by the song, as it reached #1 in three countries and was #1 in Europe’s charts.

description.plain:
“Since U Been Gone” was released as the second single from Kelly Clarkson’s second album, Breakaway.

To continue with the trend of twos, it’s also the second track on the tracklisting, and peaked at number two on the Billboard Hot 100. Oh, and it was ranked number four hundred eighty—you guessed it—two on Rolling Stone’s 500 Greatest Songs Of All Time.

annotatable.title: Love So Soft
annotatable.link_title: Love So Soft by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
“Love So Soft” is Kelly Clarkson’s lead single from her eighth studio album, Meaning of Life. The track is a soul-trap anthem, very different from the usual mainstream pop sound of Clarkson’s previous releases.

Elvis Duran, during an interview with Kelly, said that her voice on “Love So Soft” has attitude:

It’s attitude, it’s the soul we’ve been hearing since before Aretha Franklin (…). You can take one note and make it like something so soulful (…), it sounds so good!

Forbes Magazine compares “Love So Soft” to the unprecedented chart success of “Mercy”, performed by the Welsh singer Duffy :

“Love So Soft” picks up where Duffy’s “Mercy” left off almost a decade ago, finding direct inspiration in the past and placing those sounds into a more modern context.

annotatable.title: It's Quiet Uptown
annotatable.link_title: It’s Quiet Uptown by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
A cover of “It’s Quiet Uptown” from Hamilton, this song describes the pain, suffering, and eventual forgiveness Alexander Hamilton and his wife, Eliza Hamilton, went through after the loss of their child, Philip.

But, being a part of the Hamilton Mixtape and not the official soundtrack, all references to characters have been taken out. Instead, the cover speaks to a more general sense of forgiveness, such that the emotional core is not the relationship between Alexander and Eliza, but the idea of this occurring in your own world. It removes the idea of loss from specifically Phillip’s death, to some sort of unbearable suffering.

body.plain:
“I Don’t Think About You” is the 11th track of Kelly Clarkson’s 2017 album “Meaning of Life” and is the second radio single.

The soul-infused power-balled chronicles losing a prominent love in your life only to realize you’re better off without them.

body.plain: “Breakaway” was released as a single from The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement soundtrack. The song was then later included on Kelly Clarkson’s “Breakaway” album. The song managed to reach #6 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song was originally recorded by Avril Lavigne before being given to Kelly. Avril Lavigne’s version leaked online back in 2014.

body.plain:
“Meaning of Life” is the title track and third song released from Clarkson’s eighth studio album. The singer, who’s taking a new direction on her career after joining Atlantic Records, said that “Meaning of Life is the song that started this entire project. The vibe, soul and message of this song was very critical to show other writers and producers of the new direction we were taking.”

Along with the studio version of “Meaning of Life,” Clarkson also shared a live performance of the track, recorded at the War Memorial Auditorium in Nashville.

annotatable.title: Already Gone
annotatable.link_title: Already Gone by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
“Already Gone” was the third single released from Kelly Clarkson’s 2008 album, All I Ever Wanted. The song managed to reach #13 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. When the song was released as a single, there was controversy around comparisons between Kelly Clarkson’s “Already Gone” and Beyoncé’s “Halo” sounding quite similar when it came to both of their song’s arrangements. Both songs were produced by the same producer, Ryan Tedder. Kelly commented on the controversy, saying:

“Ryan and I met each other at the record label, before he was working with anyone else […] We wrote about six songs together, four or five of them made the album. It was all fine and dandy. I’d never heard of a song called ‘Halo’. Beyoncé’s album came out when my album was already being printed. No-one’s gonna be sittin' at home, thinking ‘Man, Ryan Tedder gave Beyoncé and Kelly the same track to write to.’ No, they’re just gonna be saying I ripped someone off. I called Ryan and said, ‘I don’t understand. Why would you do that?”

Ryan Tedder eventually responded to Kelly’s criticism of the two songs.

Already Gone' is one of the best songs I’ve written or produced since ‘Bleeding Love’ and stands tall on it’s  own merits apart from ‘Halo’. They are two entirely different songs conceptually, melodically, [and] lyrically and I would never try to dupe an artist such as Kelly Clarkson or Beyoncé into recording over the same musical track, the idea is both hurtful [and] absurd. I think when people hear ‘Already Gone’ they will hear what I hear—one of the greatest female vocalists on earth giving her most haunting and heart-breaking performance on a song she helped write. I challenge people to listen and form their own opinions."

description.plain:
“Heartbeat Song” is the lead single of Kelly Clarkson’s seventh album, Piece by Piece.
It’s a bouncy pop-rock track about finding a new, exciting lover after a long period of sadness.

It’s also the first song she released since having her first child, River. Clarkson told Z100 that the beat is “actually River’s heartbeat slowed down from when she was in my tummy!”



The song was produced by Greg Kurstin(most famous for his work with Adele), and written by a team of veteran songwriters—Mitch Allan, Kara DioGuardi, Jason Evigan, and relative newcomer Audra Mae. According to Mae, DioGuardi had the inspiration for the song’s hook:

The process was really fun, it was a two-day session and Kara, she gets inspiration like being struck by lighting. She literally jumped off the couch in the studio and she stood right up and just started singing the hook: “This is my heartbeat song and I’m gonna play it!” And I went “Oh my god, that’s so great!” It was really cool.

body.plain:
“Broken & Beautiful” is a Kelly Clarkson song for the soundtrack of the 2019 animation movie UglyDolls, in which the singer stars. Written by fellow American singer P!nk with Johnny McDaid, Steve Mac and Marshmello and produced by the latter two, the track was released as the first single of the album on March 27, 2019.

The lyrics talk about being proud of one’s flaws and not allowing people to change them, as they’re things that make the person unique and beautiful, a common theme in both Clarkson and P!nk’s music.

body.plain:
Miss Independent was released as the first single from Clarkson’s first studio album, Thankful. Critics acclaimed it for continuing to eliminate her “American Idol” image.

In the US, it peaked at number nine, becoming her second consecutive top ten single. It also reached a top ten position in Australia, Belgium (Flanders), the Netherlands, and the UK. It reached eleven in Ireland.

annotatable.title: Behind These Hazel Eyes
annotatable.link_title: Behind These Hazel Eyes by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain: A recent breakup has devastated the protagonist of this song. Before the breakup she had made herself open and vulnerable to her partner, which resulted in a strong connection and happiness. Now that they are not together, she is extremely upset on the inside. In contrast to her earlier openness, she puts up a front to make it seem that everything is fine.

annotatable.title: Underneath the Tree
annotatable.link_title: Underneath the Tree by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
Underneath the Tree is a song by Kelly Clarkson, from her sixth studio album and first Christmas album, Wrapped in Red. it is a Christmas-themed song that sings of gratitude for companionship during the holidays, in which the beloved is being referred as the only present needed “underneath the tree”. Accompanied by various instrumental sounds, the song prominently incorporates a Wall of Sound treatment along with sleigh bells and bell chimes to resonate a holiday atmosphere.

“Underneath the Tree” has been praised by music critics, who considered it as the main highlight of Wrapped in Red and lauded its potential to be a holiday classic. They also complimentarily compared it to the 1994 modern Christmas standard “All I Want for Christmas Is You” by Mariah Carey

annotatable.title: My Life Would Suck Without You
annotatable.link_title: My Life Would Suck Without You by Kelly Clarkson

body.plain:
“My Life Would Suck Without You” was released as the first single from Clarkson’s fourth studio album, All I Ever Wanted

It made its chart debut on the Hot 100 at 97. The next week, it leaped to number one, breaking the record for most positions moved upwards in one week as well as biggest leap to number one, beating Britney Spears’s “Womanizer” which had jumped to the top slot from 96. This is in fact the second time she has set the record––her debut single “A Moment Like This” managed to move 52-1 in its second week. The song peaked at number one in both the US and UK, while becoming a top five hit in Australia.

description.plain:
Kelly Brianne Clarkson (born April 24, 1982) is an American singer, songwriter, and occasional actress. In 2002, she came to prominence after winning the first season of American Idol, and has since been established as “The Original American Idol”. Her debut single, “A Moment Like This”, topped the US Billboard Hot 100 and broke the record for the biggest jump to number one in the chart’s history.

Her first album, Thankful included the top ten single “Miss Independent”, which earned her first Grammy nomination. Her second album Breakaway produced the hit single “Since U Been Gone” which reached number two on the Hot 100 and was certified platinum by the RIAA.

Clarkson went in a different direction with her self-creatively-controlled third album, My December. It debuted at number two on the Billboard 200 and produced the top-ten single “Never Again.” Her fourth album, All I Ever Wanted debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. Lead single “My Life Would Suck Without You” re-broke the record for biggest jump to number one on the Hot 100, jumping 97-1 in its second week on the chart. The record still stands today.

Fifth album Stronger produced the top-ten “Mr. Know It All” and her third number one, “Stronger (What Doesn’t Kill You).” Later, she released her greatest hits album, producing the top-twenty single “Catch My Breath.” Her holiday album, Wrapped in Red became the highest-selling holiday album of 2013, which made Clarkson the first female to accomplish a feat.

Her sixth album, Piece by Piece, was released on March 3, 2015. Lead single “Heartbeat Song” was released on January 12, 2015, and has peaked at 21 on the Hot 100.
